info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 3:55PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Douglas and northwestern Klamath Counties through 430 PM PDT... At 354 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Diamond Lake and near Thielsen View Campground, or 16 miles north of Crater Lake, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... East Lemolo Campground, Highway 138 Diamond Lake Summit, Diamond Lake, Broken Arrow Campground, Clearwater Falls Recreation Site, Thielsen View Campground and Whitehorse Falls Recreation Site. This includes the following highways... Highway 230 in Oregon between mile markers 13 and 23. Highway 138 in Oregon between mile markers 64 and 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
